results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, WH Productions and SA Films

results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye, David Holden and Peter Schnitzler

results.title: Vision. [No. 32]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye, David Holden, Peter Schnitzler, Paul Ryan and Hiro Narita
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Hydrolab - for 7 days, four young scientists live and work in an undersea hydrolab studying the coral reef off the Bahamas; Blind skiing - ski instruction to the sightless; Art squad - in Los Angeles, a number of imaginitive artists have transformed plain city walls into colorful murals; Mary Decker - a track star at the age of 15 is seen preparing for a big meet, working out with her coach, and the race itself; Primates - the Yerkes Regional Primate Centre - a research facility devoted to the study of monkeys and the great apes. Narrated by Peter Haskell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye, David Holden, Peter Schnitzler, Paul Ryan and Hiro Narita

Narrated by Peter Haskell.

results.title: Vision. [No. 31]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye and David Holden
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Magic Castle - a private club for magicians in Hollywood Hills; Aerial logging - huge helium balloons lift fallen logs from a steep hillside and carry them to the timberyard; Chuck Huntington - Ramsay Junior High School in Minnesota has an artist-in-residence who creates objects with a blowtorch and junk materials; Brain pacemaker - a new pacemaker for the brain; Old time fiddlers - today, amateur fiddlers in the US still travel miles to play, sing and pass along the tunes of their forefathers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye and David Holden

results.title: Vision. [No. 30]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye, David Holden, Peter Schnitzler and Paul Ryan
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Henri Temianka leads an unusual orchestra of medical professionals; a Wyoming ranch hand and dog sled racer wins in finals; on-the-spot medical care for the seriously injured and ill; 50,000 school children eadch year to go out on the floating oceanographic research vessel; the story of a women’s wear firm; and the speed and precision of a ‘short-order” cook.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, WH Productions, Donald Wrye, David Holden, Peter Schnitzler and Paul Ryan

results.title: Vision. [No. 29]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Mt Copper, Colorado - hot dog skiing, free style; Korczak Ziolkowski, mountain carver - Memorial to Chief Crazy Horse being carved at Thunderhead Mountain; Music on the move - St Paul Chamber Orchestra; Driverless vehicles - “robots” in Detroit’s Harpers Hospital move through specially designed tunnels and corridors, take their own elevators and carry food, linen and supplies; Richard Petty, racecar driver - winner of over 150 US Grand National races. Narrated by Michael Tolan.

results.title: Vision. [No. 28]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Colleges in America teach puppetry; US Patent Office grants exclusive rights to and protects all new inventions; an aerial circus; an exploration of how solar energy houses work and some examples; Girls’ Basketball Tournament in Iowa is complete with bands, beauty queens and drill teams; Thoreau’s Walden Pond philosophy he created when he lived in the wilderness.

results.title: Vision. [No. 27]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: Senior softball - a softball league whose players are all 75 years of age or older; Busch Gardens - where people enjoy riding, animal shows etc; Hamburger University - the school training thoe who operate McDonald’s restaurants; house-on-the rocks - a ‘castle in the sky’ perched on top of a rugged 450 foot high chimney rock; Harpers Ferry - John Sergem, wood carver, creates plaques, busts and other exhibits for display in national parks; Eva Jessye - one of the great names in Black American music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Agency, SA Films and Sidney R Aronson

results.title: Vision. [No. 26]
results.creator_credit: United States Information Agency, Ted Steeg Productions, Jim Strongin and Ted Steeg
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine: School of the Arts; Los Angeles Freeway; fish farming with the Lummis - an Indian tgribe has mastered the science of fish-farming; frostbiting - people who sail all year round braving winter winds and temperatures; homesteading - deserted town houses are granted to citizens willing to make them liveable again; head in the stars - Ken Kulak, 12 years old, runs a planetarium and studies computer sciences and astronomy; Theater of the Deaf - a repertory company tours the world performing for deaf and non-deaf people alike.
